BTClient Class Reference

The BTClient defines the behaviour of a BitTorrent client. More...

#include <BTClient.h>

Detailed Description

The BTClient defines the behaviour of a BitTorrent client.

Date:
2009-06-07
Version:
1.2
Author:
Blekinge Institute of Technology TEK-ATS

int BTClient::do_sendToClient ( const char *  client,
cPacket *  msg,
simtime_t  delay 
) [private]

Sends a message to a peer.

Is called through queuePacket, don't use this call directly!

msg Pointer to the message to be send
client The ID of the peer to which message will be send
delay The waiting time before the message will be send

void BTClient::requestNewPiece ( const char *  peer_id  )  [private]

Generates a new piece request and sends it to peer.

If no piece could be found to download then a not interested message will be send instead.

Member Data Documentation

int BTClient::algorithm [private]

Defines the algorithm used for piece selection.

This value is laoded from the initialisation file at the startup of the simulation (see OMNeT).

Referenced by BTClient(), and initialize().

simtime_t BTClient::arrivalTime [private]

Defines the arrival time.

This value is set by the ClientAssigner upon creation of the peer. This for statistical purposes.

vector<Piece*> BTClient::pendingMessages [private]

Stores the messages that are waiting to be send.

Messages are placed in a queue because measurements have shown that piece messages are processed according to a specific distribution. Queuing these message gives the abillity to control this behaviour. This is necassery because OMNeT is an event based simulator.

Referenced by handleCancel(), handlePieceRequest(), and handleSelfMessage().

simtime_t BTClient::seed_time [private]

The amount of time that will be seeded once the seeder states is attained.

This value is set by the ClientAssigner upon creation of the peer. This for statistical purposes.
